body_html:
I normally use Ubuntu 14.04 but I had no problems installing from sources using:

Ubuntu 16.04
Cuda 8
Cudnn 5.1.5
tensorflow0.11rc1
Bazel 0.3.2

These are the steps I took, and I try to keep them up to date with each new version. I did notice a couple expected problems when trying to build and install using anaconda 3 if you just do conda install pip and use the pip packages from tf's website it works fine. I also notice a couple things that might cause issues with those Nvidia instructions.

body:
I normally use Ubuntu 14.04 but I had no problems installing from sources using:

Ubuntu 16.04 
Cuda 8
Cudnn 5.1.5
tensorflow0.11rc1
Bazel 0.3.2

These are the [steps](http://wp.me/p7GvOc-2H) I took, and I try to keep them up to date with each new version.  I did notice a couple expected problems when trying to build and install using anaconda 3 if you just do conda install pip and use the pip packages from tf's website it works fine. I also notice a couple things that might cause issues with those Nvidia instructions.
